ratings.comment: Lectures are complex but thorough, he explains everything plainly without assuming prior knowledge unlike other NE professors. Textbook readings can help better understanding at times but all the same info is provided in lecture. Homework problems are easy to get stuck on but similar to the examples he works through in class.
Fantastic Professor. One of the best professors I have had at UW. Some of the comments here are ridiculous. This is Nuclear Engineering, it is supposed to be difficult.
Professor is unclear about what's covered on test, tests are unclear, and homework is long.

Professor Henderson is extremely helpful and his lectures are clear and concise. He is the type of professor who covers tough material by giving clear, easy-to-understand examples. HW is very tough. Tests are straightforward. Grading is fair.   Attendance matters. GO TO CLASS! He's always available for office hours and to help.

Professor Henderson is the worst professor I've had here. His teaching style is to spew random information (90% of which is irrelevant) and hand you packets, lots of packets. His homework is extremely tough because he doesn't give any examples the questions are poorly worded. Expect to teach yourself and get it wrong. Avoid if you can.

The only reason I come to class is to get all of the handouts that Henderson gives out. Most of the homework requires formulas found only in the packets he gives out, and most of what he sayswrites down is completely useless. He is an ineffective lecturer at best.

Henderson assigns homework without discussing the vast majority of the material, and he assigns a lot of homework. Expect homework to take 5-6 hours. He's unclear about what he does teach and the book's no help. Absolutely no redeeming qualities about this professor.
You need to study from him if you really wanna become a successful Nuclear Engineer

Difficult class, but that's to be expected. The homework often requires you to derive your own equations, and he writes a lot of his own problems. Exams are also difficult. He really knows his stuff though and it's obvious that he cares about his teaching, which is what really counts, I suppose.
NE405/408  Good professor; interested in students; small class sizes; HW is a lot of math; exams are more conceptual with usually one big math problem

Tough class, and goes into a lot of useless quantum mechanics. Prof Henderson loves his algebra! So that means you better love it to else you will be hating life by the end of the semester. Tests are pretty fair though, and he curves quite nicely.

He is very derivation based, but he knows his stuff.  The class takes a lot of work, but you learn a lot.  These classes will decide for you if you can cut it as  a NEEP or not.  Very nice guy, sometimes just too smart for his own good.
